Datastructures.Theory

Class ImplicationNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • Datastructures.Theory.ImplicationNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<ImplicationNode>

    public class ImplicationNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<ImplicationNode>
    This class represents the nodes in an ImplicationDAG.
    A node contains a literal and the 'downNodes' and 'upNodes'.
    The downNodes are the literals which are implied by the node's literal.
    The upNodes imply the node's literal.
    Thus, if p -> q and q -> r the q's node has p in its upNodes and r in its downNodes. Created by ohlbach on 26.09.2018.

    • Method Detail

      • addDownNode

        public int addDownNode(ImplicationNode downNode)
        adds an implication 'this -> downNode' If downNode's literal or its negation are already in the node's downNodes list, it is not changed.
        Parameters:
        downNode - contains the implied literal
        Returns:
        1 if the literal was already in the downNodes, -1 if its negation was in the downNodes, 0 otherwise.

      • joinUps

        public void joinUps(java.util.Collection<ImplicationNode> ups)
        joins a list of ImplicationNodes to the node's upNodes list. The downNodes of the new upNodes get 'this' added.
        Parameters:
        ups - a list of new upNodes.

      • joinDowns

        public void joinDowns(java.util.Collection<ImplicationNode> downs)
        joins a list of ImplicationNodes to the node's downNodes list. The upNodes of the new downNodes get 'this' added.
        Parameters:
        downs - a list of new downNodes.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        disconnects the node from its upNodes and downNodes.
